Frine is 34 years old. She is married to Marcelino and they have 2 children who live in the home they own. Frine works as a farmer on her two hectare plot of land. She started 7 years ago and since then has tried to obtain good quality harvests with the help of her husband and some workers from the area she hires to do the complicated work like weeding and harvesting the pods.

At times, she has the help of  her three children for minor tasks. They are proud of their parents. To obtain a better result for her harvests, she fertilizes her cropland with organic fertilizer which is very good for the cacao. It also allows for natural growth and avoids artificial fertilizers. In addition to growing cacao, she also has a considerable area for coffee, which obtains good additional income. This is her third loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving to get head. She is also committed to making her payments on time. At this time, she wants 2,000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: María Mercedes de 42 años de edad, vive con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos (18, 12 y 3 años de edad). Su forma de ganarse la vida es que lava ropa ajeno entre semana va a casas a lavar y le pagan por realizar esta labor, desea con tanta urgencia poder cambiar el techo de su hogar ya que la lámina existente está muy deteriorada es por eso que solicita a FUSAI un préstamo para a comprar lamina galvanizada, pines para reparar el techo de su humilde vivienda. Confía en Dios que pronto podrá realizar este sueño.
texts.en: María Mercedes is 42 and lives with her partner and their three children, aged 3, 12 and 18. She earns money during the week by washing clothes. She goes to people's houses and they pay her to wash their clothes. She desperately needs a new roof for her house as the current sheeting is damaged. She is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy galvanised sheets and nails to repair the roof of her humble home. She trusts that God will help her realise her dream.

loans.use: to repair the roof of her home by buying galvanised sheets and nails.

loans.name: Sigaran Indah Group

texts.en:
Having had good results in their last period, the Sigaran Indah group decided to continue its loans. With a same loan amount and number of members, the loans are used to improve their pig businesses.

Ni Made wants to improve her business. With the new loan she will purchase 3 piglets and feed. She still has piglets and a sow from the previous loan. The piglets will sell after she keeps them for 2 months. The business helped her to renovate her house, and now she has a plan to save all the profit and use it for business capital later. Ni Made hopes that the Loan Officer of MUK will still train and help her to run her pig business.

loans.use: to buy three piglets and feed.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old. She is married to Julian. The couple is thankful because they have been blessed with four children. To raise her family well, Alma is busy managing their hog-raising business. She has been in this business for three years and usually earns about PHP2,500 net income per grown up pig when sold. 

Alma wants to lift her family from poor living. That's why she works hard with the business. At this moment, she wants to have more hogs to raise. To make this possible, she is requesting a loan to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them. Alma hopes that she will have the loan on hand to further improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and feed for them.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en: Merlinda is married with 4 children. She is 51 years of age and lives in Upper Bag-ong Tudela Josefina, Zamboanga Del Sur. She sells dry goods, soft drinks, office supplies, bond papers, etc. to earn a living and has had this type of work for 10 years. Each month, she earns approximately 30,000 PHP doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase new dry goods, office supplies, bond papers, soft drinks, etc. Merlinda has been a member of Paglaum MPC for almost 3 years. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions and earn more for the future.

loans.use: to purchase new dry goods, office supplies, soft drinks, bond paper, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 37 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years and also earns an income from fishing. Leonila aspires to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Education is the best legacy to every child, Vilma says. She manages a retail store business in their village while her husband is growing rice in their field to sustain their family's living. They help each other and sometimes exchange ideas to improve their respective sources of income.

Vilma is 35 years of age and has five children. She wishes for a higher income to further support their daily expenditures, including her children's allowances in school. She is now asking for a loan to buy grocery items like cold drinks, spices, toothpaste, soap and more to sell. She is hoping to give the best legacy to her children and therefore is doing her best with her business for their education.

loans.use: to buy grocery items like cold drinks, spices, toothpaste, soap and more to sell.

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en: Aileen, aged 32, is married to a driver and they are blessed with two children. She has been managing a hog raising business for almost 5 years, and she has a net income of about Php 2,000 per hog. Due to lack of capital she's asking for a loan amounting to Php 13,000 to purchase hog feeds for her hogs. She's hoping that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase hog feeds for her hogs.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon, 34 years old, is married to a farmer and they are blessed with two children. She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 10 years. In this business she's earning a net income of about Php 500 a day. 

She decided to request a loan due to insufficient funds and she's requesting an amount of Php 10,000 to purchase noodles, canned goods, biscuits, sugar, coffee and beverages to sell. She's hoping that her retail store will improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase noodles, canned goods, biscuits, sugar, coffee, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
This is Nancy. She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for 40,000 PHP to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. The profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Nancy dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to have a good future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Boeun

texts.en:
Boeun is from a village of the Moung Ruessei district, Battambang. She is 44 years old and lives with her family of eight members. Three of the children are still attending school. She is a farmer who works hard on a small piece of land, but her income is still not stable and hardly enough to feed her family. To financially support this family, two of her children decided to work in Thailand in return for a fee and send remittances home to their parents each month.

Boeun has requested a loan amounting to 700 US dollars to pay for construction supplies she will use to build a latrine and pay for labor costs. This will increase the value of her family and promote their health because currently there is no bathroom in the house. More importantly, the family will release fewer pollutants and keep the environment surrounding her house clean. She is very happy and thankful because with this loan HKL has provided her a special interest rate other than its general loan.

loans.use: to pay for construction supplies she will use to build a latrine and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 64-year-old married woman. She has 7 children with ages ranging from 9 years to 40 years. She describes herself as credible. She operates a retail store where she sells beans, sugar, cooking oil, maize flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a profitable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the inflation of prices which reduces the profits. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy flour, sugar and maize to sell. Her business goal is to become a leading trader in the area within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will be self-reliant. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. The previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and maize to sell.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret, a 59-year-old married mother of eight children ranging in age from 6 years to 40 years, describes herself as honest. For 10 years now she has operated a cereals store where she sells maize and beans. Located in an area conducive to the business, her primary customers are local residents. Her biggest challenge is insufficient capital to expand her enterprise. 


Margaret will use this KES 30,000 loan to buy maize to resell.  This is her second loan with SMEP DTM, her previous one for KES 20,000 fully repaid. Hoping to be self-reliant in the future, Margaret's goal is to expand within five years.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell

loans.name: Mwikali

texts.en:
Mwikali, a 24 year old single woman with a small child , describes herself as talkative. A water vendor for three years now, her business is located in a commercial area, and her primary customers are both men and women. She describes her biggest challenges as insufficient business funds and frequent water shortages. 


Mwikali will use this KES 15,000 loan to buy a cart for transporting water to her clients. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children up to the graduate level. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: Buy a cart for transporting water to her clients.

loans.name: Petrona Fatima

texts.es:
Fatima Petrona de 52 años de edad, soltero con hijos mayores de edad. Es originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de  occidente del país. Fátima es una mujer trabajadora, responsable  de buenas costumbres con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de su tiempo libre para pasar en compañia de su familia.

Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de carne en su casa de habitación, Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de carne , para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Fátima Petrona agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en:
Fátima Petrona is fifty-two years old and is single with older children.  She is a native of León, a city located in the western part of the country.  Fátima is a very hardworking and responsible woman, and she has a lot of drive to make herself better.  In her free moments, she likes to enjoy time in the company of her family.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to move ahead, she now sells meat from her home.  She makes a living offering her products twelve hours each day.  She will use the loan to invest in working capital and to supply her business so that in the near future, she can make a better income.  

Fátima Petrona is grateful for the help that the Kiva investors have offered to people with scarce resources from poor countries, like Nicaragua.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to supply her business selling meat.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, a married woman with four children, describes herself as honest. She operates a hotel where she sells food, a business she has been involved in for two years. Located in a busy area, her primary customers come from all walks of life. Her biggest challenge is insufficient business funds. 


Agnes will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more chairs and tables for use in the hotel. She hopes to have a financially stable business in the future, as she plans to have a big hotel within five years. This is Agnes' first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more chairs and tables for use in the hotel

loans.name: Ukuri Group

texts.fr:
Césarie  fait partie du groupe  Ukuri  et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 23 ans et est mariée à  Egide,  un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 1 enfant.
Sa famille a élève 3 enfants membre de la famille élargie.

Elle  fait le commerce des fruits et légumes  depuis  4 ans. 

Elle est à son deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  la quantité des fruits et légumes à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Césarie is a member of the Ukuri group and lives in Gitega. She is 23 years old and married to Egide, a shopkeeper. They have one child together. Césarie's family is raising 3 children as part of their extended family. She has been in the business of fruits and vegetables for the last 4 years. She is on her second loan with Turame. With the loan from Kiva that she obtains, she will increase the quantity of fruits and vegetables to resell, in order to earn more money.

loans.use: increase the quantity of fruits and vegetables to resell in order to earn more

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Dorica, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children who are still going to school. She has been running two businesses: dagaa (fried small fish) and a grocery.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Dorica's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more stock of fried dagaa (very small fish) and to restock the out-of-stock drinks in the grocery inventory. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to buy a plot. She really appreciates the loan, which used to be weekly but now it has gone to bi-weekly.  She is also happy that the percent of interest rate has gone down. She is really doing great.  She will use this loan to  buy chairs and tables for the grocery and more drinks. She dreams of opening a supermarket.

Dorica will share this loan with her loan group "Karibu View," which has eight members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chairs and tables for the grocery, and more drinks.

loans.name: Minazini Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her mid 40s, is married with three children who are still going to school.  She has been having several businesses, selling clothes, cooking oil and traditional chicken since 2001. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Amina's seventh loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more jerrycans of cooking oil and bought more chicken and chicks. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees, bought a plot of land, bought a mattress and covered household expenses. She will use this loan buy more chicks for broilers. She dreams of building her own house.

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, "Minazini," with five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicks for broilers.

loans.name: Felistah

texts.en:
Felistah is a 28-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be aggressive. She operates a hotel where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area fit for the business, and her primary customers are college students. She describes her biggest business challenge to be government policies. 

She will use the 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to add stock of cooking oil, wheat and maize flour and other ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to be stable and successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to add stock of cooking oil, wheat and maize flour and other ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Lesli

texts.es:
Doña Lesli es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con su esposo e hijos en un Barrio al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de golosinas y vende desde su casa de habitación y de manera ambulante, desde hace más de 4 años.
Doña Lesli el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de manteca, frijoles, queso, plátanos, carnes, verduras, etc. que son la materia prima para seguir realizando su negocio. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más producto que ofrecer y atender mejor a sus clientes.
Doña Lesli espera cubrir las necesidades que tiene y mejorar un poco su calidad de vida y la de su familia. En unos años espera que su negocio siga creciendo y se convierta en una tienda de golosinas donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.
Doña Lesli su sueño es tener un local más grande y sea muy reconocido de la zona para elevar sus ingresos y que sus hijos se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la sociedad.


Choluteca, Honduras –Agosto del 2013
texts.en:
Doña Lesli is a responsible, honest, and hardworking person who lives with her husband and children in a barrio in southern Honduras. She has for over four years sold food both in her home and in the street. 

Doña Lesli is applying for a loan so that she can purchase butter, beans, cheese, bananas, meat, vegetables, and other goods that are the essential supplies she needs to continue operating her business. She hopes that the loan will  lead to better customer service and increased sales as she'll have more foods to offer. Doña Lesli hopes that an expanded menu will lead to increased sales will help her meet her expenses and improve her family's quality of life a little bit. She hopes that her business will continue to grow in the next few years and that she can open a food shop in her home, offering better service to her customers. Doña Lesli's ambition is to have a bigger store and gain a reputation throughout the area in order to boost her income and allow her her children to become upstanding people with greater opportunities in their society.   

Choluteca, Honduras – August 2013

loans.use: to purchase butter, beans, cheese, bananas, meat, vegetables, and other goods for her business.

loans.name: Victorino

texts.es: Victorino es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. De 50 años de edad, casado y padre de 4 hijos. Es de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, trigo y cuido de ganado, actividad que realiza desde hace 30 años.  Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado salir adelante.  Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso la crianza y venta de cerdos. Su expectativa es realizar  su siembra con éxito, ya que podrá vender un producto de calidad para sus clientes. Solicita el crédito para comprar insumos como: Fertilizantes, pesticida, urea, abono y el pago de mano de obra en esta cosecha realizada. El crédito será de mucha ayuda por lo que en estos momentos no tiene capital para invertir. Estima que al cancelar el préstamo, podrá solicitar otro con el fin de  crecer económicamente para el bienestar de su negocio y familia.
texts.en: Victorino is originally from the city of Boaca.  At 50 years old he is married and a father to four children.  He is a farmer, making a living growing corn and wheat, and raising cattle.  He has been doing this work for 30 years.  Thanks to his effort and dedication, he has been able to do well in life.  He also makes money from raising and selling pigs.  His expectation is to grow his crops successfully as he will then be able to sell his customers good quality products.  Victorino is applying for this loan in order to buy supplies such as fertilisers, pesticides, urea, manure, and to pay for labourers.  The loan will be of great help as Victorino does not currently have any capital to invest in his business.  Victorino reckons that, once this loan is paid off, he will be able to apply for another one in order to improve his business's and his family's financial stability.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as fertilisers, pesticides, urea, manure, and to pay for labourers.

loans.name: Jackelin

texts.es: Jackelin es una joven de 20 años, está casada con Saúl y tiene una niña de 1 año con quien vive en la casa de sus padres . Jackelin tiene un pequeño establecimiento en donde se dedica a la reparación de neumáticos. Es una labor que su esposo aprendió desde muy joven apoyando en el taller de unos familiares dedicados a la misma actividad. Fue así que emprendieron de a pocos con la compra de los equipos necesarios para brindar un buen servicio a los propietarios de distintos vehículos que visitan su negocio ya que se caracteriza por ser una persona muy hábil y honrada a la vez. Por su parte Jackelin se encarga de supervisar  y realizar las cobranzas. En el futuro espera comprarse un lote de terreno y posteriormente realizar la construcción de una vivienda para así brindarle una buena calidad de vida a su pequeña y posteriormente optar por otro negocio adicional. Este es su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con  2,000 nuevo soles para la compra de neumáticos para motos y mototaxis para su negocio.
texts.en: Jackelin is 20 years old, married to Sául and has a one-year-old daughter.  They live in her parents' house.  Jackelin has a small business where she makes a living repairing tyres.  Her husband learned this work from a very young age, as he supported family members who worked in the same trade.  With this knowledge Jackelin and Saúl gradually started their business, buying the necessary equipment to provide good service to the owners of various types of vehicles.  The vehicle owners come to the shop, where Jackelin is both very skilled and honest.  Jackelin is in charge of supervising the work and for billing.  In the future she hopes to buy a plot of land and then build a home in order to provide her young daughter with a good quality of life.  She then wants to start another business.  This is Jackelin's second Kiva loan and she is very grateful for the financial support that she is receiving in order to get ahead.  Jackelin promises to make her monthly repayments on time.  On this occasion Jackelin is applying for 2000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy tyres for cars and motorbikes.

loans.use: to buy tyres for cars and motorbikes.

loans.name: Jose Marcos

texts.es: José, tiene 55 años de edad, esta soltero, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de La Masica, Atlántida. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura y hace 3 años decidió establecer un negocio de brindar servicio con un molino de moler granos como ser maíz, arroz, coco, pinol, etc. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa y atiende todo el día. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 4000 Lempiras y lo va utilizar para la compra de medicinas naturales como manzanilla, anís, ajo, quina, etc. y farmacéuticos como pastillas para la venta de la misma con el propósito de poder tener otra fuente de ingresos además del molino. Su plan es que el negocio tanto del molino como de la venta de medicinas crezca y obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
José is 55 years old, single, has two children and lives in the municipality of La Masica, Atlántida. He used to be a farmer but three years ago he decided to start a business offering the services of a grain mill to mill corn, rice, coconut, pinol (a roasted corn-based drink) etc. He has the business in his house and he looks after it every day.

José has requested a loan of 4,000 HNL which he will use to buy  natural medicines like camomile, anise, garlic, quinine, etc and  pharmaceuticals like pills for resale. The objective of this would be to give him another source of income other than the mill. His plan is that the mill and the sale of medicines grow and he can generate a better income.

loans.use: to buy natural medicines like camomile, anise, garlic, quinine, etc and  pharmaceuticals like pills to resell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 29-year-old, married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be committed. 

He is a mechanic and he does motor vehicle repairs. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area fit for the business and his primary customers are vehicle owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of proper machines to improve service delivery. 

William will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy machines to help in repairing motor vehicles. His business goal is to be stable within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy machines to help in repairing vehicles.

loans.name: Nzadze

texts.en:
Nzadze is a married woman with three children, two in school and one who is still underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 39-year-old single woman. She has two children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough money. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to add stock of clothes for resale. Her business goal is to own a wholesale boutique within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a happy life.

loans.use: to add stock of clothes for resale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
This is Lourdes, age 54, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is a widow and she has children. She is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Lourdes operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings whene all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a loan of PHP 12,000. She will use the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Lourdes dreams that her business will continue to flourish and she will have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno appreciates the previous loan she had from Kiva that enabled her to improve on her living standards through the profits she generated.
She is requesting a loan of KES 80,000 to purchase five goats for her business.She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase five goats for her business

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is a married woman, with three children who attend school. She lives in her house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. 

She has operated a poultry farming business for the past five years .She faces a major challenge of diseases that affect her chicks.

With the KES 30,000 loan, Mbeyu wants to purchase poultry feed and five chicks. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed and five chicks.

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is a 37-year-old, married man from Talibon, Bohol. He has three children, ages 3, 10, and 11. 

Alejandro raises and sells pigs to earn a living. He has been raising pigs for almost three years. 

He requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy hog feed and materials for pigpen renovation, to increase his income and expand his hog-raising business. 

In the future, Alejandro hopes to build a bigger pigpen and also renovate his house, to provide his children with good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hog feed and materials for pigpen renovation.

loans.name: Mukenyeziterimbere Group

texts.fr:
Pélagie  fait partie du groupe Mukenyeziterimbere   et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 41 ans et est mariée.  Sa famille comporte 7 enfants âgés de 3 à 19 ans, dont 5 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de boutique (riz, savons, huile de palme,..)  depuis  10 ans. 

Elle est à son cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  la quantité d’articles (riz, savons, huile de palme,…) à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en: Pélagie is a member of the Mukenyeziterimbere group and lives in Gitega. She is 41 years old and married. Her family has 7 children aged 3 to 19 years, 5 of whom attend school. She has run a shop business (rice, soaps, palm oil, etc.) for the last 10 years. She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With the Kiva loan that Pélagie obtains, she will increase the quantity of items (rice, soaps, palm oil, etc.) that she resells, in order to earn more.

loans.use: to increase the quantity of items (rice, soaps, palm oil, etc.) to resell, in order to earn more.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer, 37, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Dario, a sewer, and mother to their children. Jennifer operates a vegetable stand and buys different vegetables from a trusted dealer to sell at her stall. She also sells frozen and processed food for additional income. Jennifer works very hard to send her children to college and to provide for their everyday needs. Her husband is very supportive of her and he is also working for their family. Jennifer’s regular customers are neighbors and local community members. She earns a minimum of 750 PHP each day. 

Jennifer is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan to buy more quantities of fruit and vegetables to expand her product inventory. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and flourish. Jennifer meets up with her co-fellowship* members each week to share stories of her work every week.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en: Nyamvula appreciates her previous Kiva loan. She is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase cooking oil, bread, sugar, and salt to sell. Nyamvula thanks Yehu and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, bread, sugar, and salt to sell

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar is 57-year-old woman who is married with two daughters and three sons. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. The financial condition of Mukhtar's family is not good as her husband sits idle at home and her children are unskilled. Her sons are working different kinds of jobs, but they earn a very low income. One of Mukhtar's sons owns a tailoring shop and sews gent’s clothing. He has been using a local sewing machine that is very slow and his work is not proper or fine. Her son wants to enhance the beauty of his stitching and buy a juki machine (professional sewing machine). Professionals use this machine because of its fine speed and good stitching. 

Mukhtar is requesting a loan so that her son can buy a new sewing machine to improve his tailoring work. She is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for her son

loans.name: Qodir

texts.ru: Кодиру 27 лет, он из города Вахдат. Кодир женат и имеет детей. У него высшее образование. Он по специальности бухгалтер. Кодир сейчас хочет заняться собственным бизнесом, ему не нравится офисная скучная работа и иметь начальника. Кодир хочет зарабатывать и одновременно быть свободным. Поэтому он решил заняться услугой такси. Он имеет водительские права с 18-летнего возраста и у него хороший опыт вождения. Он знает все переулки своего города. Кодир накопил немного сбережение и просит еще кредит, чтобы купить машину и начать работать. Он планирует возить пассажиров по маршруту Вахдат – Душанбе. Это достаточно прибыльный бизнес. Кодир очень надеется на Вас.
texts.en:
Qodir is 27 years old. He is from the town of Vahdat. Qodir is married and has children. He has a higher education. He majored in accounting. 

Qodir now wants to engage in his own business; he does not like boring office work and having a boss. Qodir wants to make a living and at the same time to be free. Therefore, he decided to engage in taxi services. He has had a driver's license since he was 18 and he has a lot of driving experience. He knows all the side streets in his city. Qodir has accumulated some savings and is asking for another loan in order to purchase a car and to start working. 

He plans to transport passengers along the route Vahdat – Dushanbe. This is quite a profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase a car in order to start a taxi service business

loans.name: Kishwer

texts.en:
Basic Information:
Kishwer’s age is 35; she is married, living in Lahore, with her four children.

Financial Condition:
The financial position and condition of her family is very poor because her husband is a tailor by profession and he has owned a tailoring shop for many years. He could not get popularity among the people of his hometown, and this is the reason he has not enough customers on his list. Kishwer's children are very young and fully dependent upon their parents. She does not have any other source of income so she decided to start tailoring at home.

Experience and Hobbies:
Kishwer learned tailoring techniques from stitching school; she already has interest in sewing clothes, so she has chosen her hobby for her profession. In this way, with the completion of her hobby, she would be able to give financial support to her family as well. 

Need to take a loan:
Kishwer wants to utilize her clothing experience and wants to get more profit but she is compelled to take a loan due to her low financial condition. Therefore, she showed her interest to take a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan.

Hopes & Dreams:
She hopes that she will utilize this loan positively and can grow her business. Her dreams are to provide better facilities, living standards and charming clothes to her children.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine for tailoring.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Mtamakulanga Group

texts.en:
Devetha is in her late 20s and married with two children, one of whom is going to school. For the past two years, she has been running a food-vending business. Devetha is doing great with her business. She works from six thirty in the morning through seven thirty at night and is able to make a small profit. Devetha is requesting her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to buy more cooking items. Devetha has repaid her loan successfully and she used her profit to cover home expenses and school fees.

Devetha is the leader of a group loan. Her loan group, “Mtamakulanga,” consists of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. Devetha will use her portion of the loan to restock missing items in her store. In the future, she dreams of building a business premise instead of renting.

loans.use: to restock food items in her store

loans.name: Ziynegul

texts.ru: Зийнегул 38 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Зийнегул - высшее образование, работает в местной больнице, в качестве медсестры. Коллеги отзываются о ней, как о трудолюбивом и спокойном человеке. Зийнегул в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зийнегул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 головы крупного рогатого скота, а также 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота, ежемесячный доход составляет 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зийнегул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки нескольких голов мелкого рогатого скота. Доходы от кредита Зинегул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Ziynegul is 38 years old, married, and together with her husband is raising four children. Ziynegul has a higher education, and works at a local hospital as a nurse. Colleagues speak highly of her as hardworking and peaceful person. 

As an additional source of income for her family, Ziynegul is involved in raising livestock, having started 15 years ago with the purchase of cattle at 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to the hard work of Ziynegul, her homestead today has: two heads of cattle and 20 heads of sheep/goats, and a monthly income of 4,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her homestead, Ziynegul turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to increase the count of livestock by buying a few heads of cattle.

Ziynegul plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the number of domestic animals, and plans to save enough money to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Lovelyn

texts.en:
This is Lovelyn, 28, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to George, a security guard and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating a business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Lovelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them piecemeal. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

Lovelyn is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Lovelyn dreams to be successful in her business and hopes to have a good life.  Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en: Aurelia is a 64-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has five grown children. She grows and sells rice to earn a living.She has been farming rice for almost 20 years. Aside from farming rice, she goes fishing. Even though she has children to support her needs, Aurelia is not dependent on them. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and materials for fishing like fish net and weights. In the future, Aurelia would like to expand her farming business to improve her livelihood status and save in preparation for old age.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and materials for fishing like fish net and weights

loans.name: G.s. Milagro De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario  Milagro de Jesús está conformado por 3 integrantes madres solteras con siete hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas personas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de salir adelante. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar por falta de recursos económicos, y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su  esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del grupo solidario es Maura Elena y tiene por actividad económica la compra  y venta de cerdos en pies. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto en su casa de habitación, ella cría los cerdos y después lo vende a clientes fijos  y eventuales. El objetivo del crédito es invertir  en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de un lote de cerdos para crianza. El grupo solidario  Milagro de Jesús agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The solidarity group named “Milagro de Jesús” (Miracle of Jesus) consists of three members.  They are single mothers who are responsible for seven children among them.  These women are originally from El Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the country.  They are known for being hardworking and responsible individuals who have the drive to succeed.  Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources, they were obligated to start working at a young age so that they could help with the household expenses.  

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to move forward, Maura Elena has assumed the position as the solidarity group coordinator.  She has a business of buying and selling live pigs.  Maura Elena manages her business with great pride from her home.  She raises the pigs and then sells them to both established and occasional customers.  The purpose of her loan is to invest it as operating capital so that she can restock her buying and selling business with a drove of pigs that she can raise.  

The solidarity group “Milagro de Jesús” is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and are from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy live pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina, aged 46, is married and blessed with four children. Tina has managed a vegetable vending business for almost 15 years. In this business she's earning a net income of Php 300 daily. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to ask for a loan amounting to Php 11,000 to purchase vegetables such as eggplant, squash, string beans, and chili leaves to sell. She hopes that her requested loan will be granted so that she can utilize it properly on her business and she's hoping that her business will continue to grow to earn more profits.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables such as eggplant, squash, string beans, and chili leaves to sell

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
This is Virgilio. His previous loan was a big help in his business as he was able to buy the needed spare parts and accessories for his Jeepney. His income from the loan helped in his everyday expenses. He continues to work hard to provide for his everyday needs.

He would now like to apply for a 35,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of the Jeepney. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover his daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Virgilio hopes to be more successful in his business and dreams of having continuous physical strength to do his work. He meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work. That is where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney (public transport vehicle).

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en:
Tabu appreciates the previous loan that increased her monthly income.  She is now requesting a loan of KSH.45,000 to purchase food ingredients such as onions, tomatoes, rice and wheat flour.

She thanks Yehu and Kiva for their loan policy.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, such as onions, tomatoes, rice, and wheat flour

loans.name: Taha

texts.en:
Taha is 24 years old and lives in Ibb, Yemen.  He didn't complete his schooling.   He collected enough to buy a van.  He uses the van to provide for his family's daily expenses; however, the amount that he earns is low. 

Recently, his van has not been working well.  He would like to buy spare parts to repair his van, but he doesn't have the money. So he applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB. 

With this loan, Taha's business will run well, and he will be able to improve his living standards. He hopes to open a grocery store to increase his profit.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his van

loans.name: Maral

texts.ru: Марал 45 лет,разведена, одна воспитывает 1 сына, проживает с престарелой матерью. У Марал - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Марал занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Марал, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 лошади, 15 овец, а также дополнительно занимается шитьем приданного для невест. Ежемесячный доход Марал составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Марал обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве. Доходы от кредита Марал планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Maral is 45 years old, divorced, is raising one son on her own, and lives with her aged mother. Maral has a specialized high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Maral is involved in raising livestock, having started ten years ago with the purchase of livestock with 15,000 som (KGS). Through Maral's hard work, she today has on her homestead: three horses, 15 sheep; and also additionally is involved in sewing dowries for brides. Maral's monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Maral turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to expand the count of livestock on her homestead.

Maral plans to invest income from the loan to further increase the count of livestock, and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Turdukan

texts.ru: Турдукан 56 лет. Совместно с супругом воспитывают четырех детей (1 дочь, 3 сына). В 2002 году, супруги начали бизнес в торговле продуктами питания, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 20,000 сом (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Турдукан имеет среднемесячный доход в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду в бизнесе, супруги смогли обзавестись скотом и приумножают его из года в год. В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Турдукан обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку автотранспорта для перевозки товаров с оптовых рынков к себе на торговую точку. Доходы от кредита Турдукан планирует вложить в благоустройство своей семьи
texts.en:
Turdukan is 56 years old. Together with her husband, she is raising four children (1 daughter, 3 sons). In 2002, the couple started a business in the food trade, using as a start-up capital a sum of 20,000 som (KGS). Having managed to grow their business and to find loyal customers, Turdukan has an average monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to hard work in her business, the couple was able to acquire livestock and multiply them from year to year.

With the aim of further expanding and growing her business, Turdukan turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase of a vehicle for transporting goods from the wholesale market to their point of sale. 

Turdukan plans to invest income from the loan for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for the purchase and transport of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his taxis and also a  display window for his wife’s kiosk business

loans.name: Zahra

texts.en:
Zahra is 34 and belongs to a middle standard family. She lives with her spouse and four children. Her residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband earns a sufficient amount and can easily afford their household expenses and the school fees of their children.  Her husband drives a mini loader vehicle; he provides loading and unloading services to a firm. 

Zahra's husband carries metal from one place to another but due to maximum load, the body and engine of his mini loader have depreciated. Now his mini loader needs maintenance, otherwise his monthly income would be highly affected because he does not have another source of income. 

Therefore, Zahra requested a loan for the maintenance of their mini loader so that her husband can smoothly earn income to run their household and to support his family. She is very hopeful Kiva lenders will support her for fund raising. 

Zahra is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: For the maintenace of their mini loader truck.

loans.name: Zyinat

texts.ru: Зыйнат 43 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Зыйнат - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, Зыйнат занимается животноводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с покупки скота на 15,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Зыйнат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 лошади, 1 дойная корова, 15 овец. Супруг активно помогает по хозяйству. Ежемесячный доход Зыйнат составляет 6,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зыйнат обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для увеличения поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве. Доходы от кредита Зыйнат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Zyinat is 43 years old, married, and is raising five children. Zyinat has a specialized high school education. As a main source of income for her family, Zyinat is engaged in raising livestock, having started ten years ago with the purchase of livestock at 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zyinat's hard work, she today has on her homestead: three horses, a dairy cow, and 15 sheep. Her husband actively helps around the farm. Zyinat's monthly income is 6,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her homestead, Zyinat turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to expand the count of livestock on her homestead. 

Zyinat plans to invest income from the loan to further augment the quantity of domestic animals and plans to save money for home repairs.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Neab

texts.en:
Neab is a 29-year-old woman living in Pursat province. She is married and has a small child. She and her spouse help each other manage their farm, growing rice to supply their sustenance and to sell to local traders. She has been involved in this for more than 10 years. 

Neab would like to have a latrine for her household.  Due to inadequate capital, she is seeking for a loan of KHR 2,000,000 from HKL. By having a latrine, she can keep her environment clean, protect her family from spreading diseases, and increase their personal hygiene. 

She is very happy and thankful because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate rather than its general loan.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her household.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур трудолюбивый и целеустремленный молодой человек. Ему 21 года. Он не женат и живет с родителями и сестрой. Он после окончания средней школы начал свой бизнес услугой такси. Баходур занимается перевозкой местных жителей в столицу и обратно. Он очень общительный и жизнерадостный молодой человек и предоставляет свои услуги на высшем уровне. Баходур всегда помогает своим родителям по домохозяйству. Скоро его сестра выходит замуж и им надо сыграть ее свадьбу. Его родители не имеют денег, чтобы организовать ее свадьбу. Баходур хочет помочь своим родителем. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7200 сомони для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Баходур ждет вашу доброту. Этот займ поможет сделать счастливой ее сестру.
texts.en:
Bahodur is a hardworking and dedicated young man. He is 21 years old. He is single and lives with his parents and sister. After graduating high school, he started his own taxi service business. Bahodur is involved in transporting local residents to the capital and back. He is a very sociable and cheerful man and provides his services at the highest level. Bahodur always helps his parents around the household. 

Soon his sister is getting married and they need to plan her wedding. His parents do not have money to organize her wedding. Bahodur wants to help his parents. He is requesting a loan of 7,200 somoni for the wedding festivities. This loan will help to make his sister happy.

loans.use: to put on a wedding party for his sister

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay costs of farm labor.

loans.name: Azam

texts.en:
Azam is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. He is 27 years old and is married. Azam is a mechanic, mainly doing welding work; a trade he has worked at for four years.
He learnt of Milango from a friend and joined in order to access funds. He is applying for a loan to buy plates and tubes for his business. This business is the only source of income for him and his family.
The only challenge in the business is the unavailability of the market for what he sells, but Azam is determined to carry out his operations well. He believes that from this venture he can establish his family. His future ambition is to be able to open another new branch for mechanical work.

loans.use: to buy plates and tubes.

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is a 30-year-old married woman. She is a very hard worker and an honest lady; she is a responsible wife and mother. She always keeps busy for the better for her family members but their shortage of income is a major hurdle which creates problems in her way toward progress. 

Her husband owns a small crockery store, in which he sells crockery items such as plates, dishes, cups, jars, glasses, jugs, mugs and buckets. Her husband has only this single source of income; he has to cover the expenses of utility bills and school fees for his children and household expenses, too. The condition of their house is not up to the mark for living.

Asma wants to reconstruct her house, and for this purpose more earnings are required so that she can save some money for construction. She requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan, so that she could increase the inventory of her husband's shop and his earnings as well.

She hopes that she will reconstruct her house and succeed in bringing positive changes into the lives of her family members, so that her family members can pass their lives comfortably. She is very thankful to Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan because they showed her a beam of hope to fulfill her desires.

loans.use: To buy crockery to resell.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is 27 years old and a poor lady.  She and her family pass their lives in a very miserable condition. Due to financial tensions, she looks older than her age. 

In fact her husband has not adopted any profession seriously; he has changed his profession from time to time for many years. A few months ago he was working as a laborer for a firm on very low wages. Now he has decided to drive a rickshaw again.  He already has a rickshaw of his own, but he has not been driving it due to its damaged body.

Shaleela advised him that he should drive his own rickshaw, and this time he has agreed to drive. Therefore, she is taking a loan to encourage her husband, so that he can buy a new rickshaw body and drive the rickshaw again. 

Shakeela hopes that her husband will be stable over this profession and drive his rickshaw for a long time.   She is very thankful to Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new body for her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 10 liters of cooking oil, 50 kgs of sugar and 50 kgs of flour

loans.name: Komron

texts.ru: Комрон трудолюбивый человек. Ему 19 лет. Он не женат и живет с матерью и братом. Он успешно учился в средней школе и активно участвовал во всех мероприятиях школы. Он после окончания средней школы поступил в университет. Данное время он учится в университете и одновременно работает в школе учителем технологии компьютера. Он успешный студент и молодой, умный преподаватель. Комрон должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Komron is a hardworking person. He is 19 years old. He is single and lives with his mother and brother. 

He successfully completed high school and was actively involved in all the activities of his school. After graduation, he enrolled in university. Currently, he is studying at a university and at the same time is working in a school as a computer technology teacher. He is a successful student and a young, intelligent teacher. Komron needs to pay his tuition but has no money.

He is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to pay tuition.

loans.use: to pay tuition at the university

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is 39 years old. She is a humble farmer and a mother of three children, who are still students. Along with her husband, Sam works hard each day to manage her farm in Battambang province and seeks for ways to advance her business. Her goal is to be able to take care of her crops and not lose her entire harvest and the time and money invested in it. Sam works eight hours a day on her farm, especially in the rainy season.

Sam is requesting a loan to build a bathroom for her house. She will use her loan to keep her environment clean, protect her family from disease, and improve her family’s personal hygiene. Sam is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders are offering her. She is very happy and thankful because, due to her loan use, HKL has provided her with a special interest rate rather than its general loan rate.

loans.use: to build a bathroom for her house

loans.name: Uon

texts.en:
Uon is a 32-year-old married woman with three dependent children. She has small pieces of farmland and grows rice to earn a living. She has been in this occupation in Pursat province for 11 years and has been the main source of her family’s income. Her husband and children encourage her as her motivation in this business.

Uon has requested a loan in the sum of 1,000 US dollars to build a latrine for her household as she considers that it’s one of the key elements to healthy living. By having a latrine for her household, she can keep her environment clean, protect herself and her family from spreading diseases and increase their personal hygiene. She is very happy and thankful, because with this loan purpose, HKL has provided her a special interest rate rather than its general loan.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her household.

loans.name: Telfilo

texts.en: Telfilo, age 36, is married and blessed with two children. He owns and operates a retail store, in which beverages are in demand. From this business, he's earning a net income of PHP 800 a day. Telfilo and his wife work together to earn more income for their children's school fees. Due to insufficient capital, he decided to request a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase beverages, canned goods, and noodles to sell. He's hoping that his requested loan will be granted so that he can make his business a profitable one.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, canned goods, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda, age 59, is already widowed, with five children. Yolanda has managed a hog-raising business for almost three years. In this business, she's earning a net income of PHP 3,000 per hog when she sells them. 

Due to inadequate capital for her business, she decided to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 18,000, to purchase two piglets and hog feed. She's now hoping that her requested loan will be granted, so that her business will be further improved and more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and hog feed.

loans.name: Asad

texts.ru: Асад 52 года. Он заботливый отец 7 детей. Его любимая жена умерла несколько лет назад, и он один воспитывает своих детей. Двое из детей совершеннолетние, а 5 еще не совершеннолетние. Он работает в птицефабрике сторожем более 3 лет.  Он замечательный человек и его сотрудники, поэтому уважают его. Он получает маленькую зарплату и это зарплата не хватает. Асад и его дети живут бедно. Его сын не имеет постоянной место работы на родине и поэтому он хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Асад не имеет денег, чтобы купить авиабилет своему сыну. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки авиабилета для своего сына. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Asad is 52 years old. He is the dedicated father of seven children. His beloved wife died a few years ago and he is bringing up their children on his own. Two of the children are grown, and five are still minors. He has been working as a watchman in a poultry farm for more than three years. He is a wonderful person and his coworkers therefore respect him. While he gets a small salary, it is not enough. Asad and his children live in poverty. 

His son does not have regular work in his home country and therefore he wants to go to the Russian Federation. Asad does not have the money to purchase an air ticket for his son. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy an airline ticket for his son.

loans.use: to buy an air ticket for his son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 150 coconuts, fodder and 10 sacks of cement

loans.name: Bienvineda

texts.en: Bienvineda is a 59-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children.The youngest child is already 18 years old. She operates a motor boat transportation service. She has been doing such business for almost 15 years. She requested a loan of 6000 PHP to buy epoxy (adhesive), marine plywood and nails for boat renovation. This will help Bienvineda improve her income and could continue to send her children to school for a bright future.

loans.use: to buy epoxy (adhesive), marine plywood and nails for boat renovation

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
This is Christopher. He previously accessed a 15,000 PHP loan that he utilized to buy burger ingredients. His earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would now like to apply for a 17,000 PHP loan that he will use to buy more burger ingredients like bread, burger patties, vegetables, mayonnaise and other ingredients. More items to sell will result in better profit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to cover their daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Christopher dreams that his business will grow bigger. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more burger ingredients like bread, burger patties, vegetables, mayonnaise, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose lives in the Kongowea area near Mombasa, Kenya. She is 23 years old, married and has a 3-year-old child. She has been in the tailoring business for the last three years and her business has been doing great. She learned about Milango through friends and now seeks a loan to buy cloth material, needles and thread for a new tailoring shop. She hopes that in the next five years she will have as many shops as possible so that she can be able to employ more people. The challenge in the business is competition, which is inevitable. The extra income that she will raise will improve her standard of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy cloth material, needles and thread

loans.name: Fakhira

texts.en:
Fakhira is a 50-year-old married woman who has three sons and two daughters. She lives with her husband in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.  Her children live separately and do not contact her. Fakhira’s husband is a very hardworking and honest person. He owns a small restaurant where he offers different types of delicious food. Fakhira cooks food in the restaurant, especially the delicious types of food people like to eat. Unfortunately, her husband appointed a worker who has broken most of the crockery while washing it. Now there isn’t sufficient crockery to offer food to the maximum number of customers. Fakhira’s husband also wants to buy some benches for seating. The family’s restaurant provides an income for both of them and provides for their medical expenses.

Fakhira is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to buy crockery and benches for seating. She thanks Kiva lenders and appreciates their warmth in supporting her.

loans.use: to buy crockery and benches for seating

loans.name: Fuad

texts.en:
Fuad, 27, is a single man who lives  in Ibb, Yemen. He is a hardworking man who likes to depend on himself.  He didn`t complete his studies due to the bad situation he faced. Over time, he has managed to collect a small amount to buy a mini-bus to earn daily expenses. 

Recently, his bus is not working well so he needs to repair his bus to continue providing for his family. He applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts to repair his bus so as to increase his daily income. He hopes to improve his living standards and own an extra bus.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to repair his mini-bus so as to increase his daily income.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married woman with six children, four of whom go to school, and two who are still too young. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

For over four years, she has operated a vegetable selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby.  She faces a major challenge of the seasonality of her business. 

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase a sack of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions.

loans.name: Tojikhon

texts.ru: Тоджихон сильная женщина. Ей 46 лет. Она разведена и имеет 1 ребенка. Тоджихон много лет хотела организовать свой бизнес и найти собственного источника дохода. С такой целью она участвовала на  курсе «Добейся Успеха» организованной Ассоциация Деловых Женщин. Она участвовала на этом курсе и получила много позитива для себя. После завершения курса она получила сертификат. Она планирует организовать бизнес скотоводством. Скот она будет держать дома, где она имеет большой коровник. Она планирует купить скот, пересматривать несколько месяцев и перепродавать на местном рынке. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  2500 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Tojikhon is a strong woman. She is 46 years old. She is married and has one child. 

For many years, Tojikhon had wanted to start her own business and to find her own source of income. With this aim, she took part in a course "Bring It On" organized by the Association of Business Women. She participated in this course and received a lot of positivity for herself. After finishing the course, she received a certificate. 

She plans to start a business raising livestock. She will keep livestock near her home where she has a large barn. She plans to buy livestock, to fatten them for a few months and to resell them in the local market. 

She is requesting a loan of 2,500 somoni to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to buy cattle for organizing a new business

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 43 years old. She is married to Julius and the mother of five children, ages one through 17. For the past 15 years, Anne has been selling vegetables in Melili town in the outskirts of Narok, Kenya. She makes a monthly income of 15,000 KES. Anne learned about Kadet from her colleagues in the market who are receiving Kadet funding. 

Anne is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy fresh vegetables in bulk from farmers. She will use the profit from her loan to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Anne dreams of expanding her business and educating her children through higher levels of learning.

loans.use: to buy fresh vegetables in bulk to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 41 years old. She is single and the mother of four children. For the past four and a half years, she has run a cereal shop in Kangemi. Florence earns 100,000 KES each month. 

Florence is requesting her second loan with KADET LTD to buy cereals such as rice, beans, and maize for her business. In the future, she wants to own a bigger shop.

loans.use: to buy cereals such as rice, beans, and maize

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a 35-year-old gentleman, married to Catherine and supporting a family of five members. His children are between the ages of eight and three years old. He is  a mixed farmer and has been in the business for the last ten years. His monthly income is KES 20,000.

He is currently servicing his fourth loan from KADET of KES 30,000 that will facilitate his preparation of the land and get planting seedlings. He plans to use the anticipated profits to diversify into livestock farming. His dream is to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to prepare land for cultivation

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is 37 years old and a hard-working lady and mother of four children aged 10, 7, 5 and 1 year old. She has been managing a tea plantation in the Bomet area for the last five years, earning a monthly income of Kes 27,000.

She has been issued with a second loan of Kes 30,000 which will facilitate her in the purchase of fertilizer for her tea plantation. This will guarantee more yield thus more income.

She will use the proceeds to pay school fees for her children. She hopes to grow her business to a large commercial venture.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for the tea plantation

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is very thankful for the financial assistance extended to him. He used his loan in his businesses which are continuously growing. He has a landscaping business and a food stall. His income from the loan was very helpful in the education of his child and in meeting everyday expenses.

He would like to apply for another 14,000 PHP loan to buy materials needed in landscaping like grasses, assorted plants, garden tools and stones. He will also use the loan for his landscaping projects. Profits from his business will definitely help him sustain his family's daily needs and educational expenses of one of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Edwin dreams to have a good life and hopes to be successful in his business. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for materials needed in landscaping like grasses, assorted plants, garden tools and stones.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan. She previously accessed a 50,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her child’s education, in their personal, household and business expenditures. She also has a passenger van for additional income.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her child’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Susan dreams to be more successful in her business and hopes to have a bright future. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 52-year-old widow living with her sons in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. At the time when her husband was alive, the family's financial condition was very good because her husband was an expert on lathe machine work and manufactured spare parts for vehicles. Her younger son learned how to operate the lathe machine from a professional person for many years. Now he can operate the lathe machine and carry on his father’s business. However, the lathe machine is in need of repair. Therefore, Safia requested a loan for her son so that he could have the lathe machine fixed. 
Safia is relieved now because she hopes that her son will be an expert soon and get a reasonable income as his father did.
Safia is very thankful to the Kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: pay for the repair and maintenance of a lathe machine.

loans.name: Fozia's Group

texts.en:
Fozia is a 33-year-old woman living with her 3 children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 
Her husband has been driving an auto rickshaw that does not belong to him for many years. With the help of savings he has purchased a used auto rickshaw, its engine quality is good but the body is totally damaged. He does not have sufficient amount to buy new body and new seat covers. He wants to start driving, but is still looking for enough capital to buy a rickshaw body. Therefore, Fozia requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy new rickshaw body and be able to drive smoothly. 
Fozia hopes that her husband will be able to earn more income because now he will not have to pay a daily fair to anyone. 
Fozia is very happy after requesting this loan and says thank to kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an auto rickshaw body and new seat covers.

loans.name: Mohina

texts.ru: Мохина добросовестная женщина. Ей 36 лет. Она вдова и одна воспитывает своих детей. Она имеет 4 детей. Ее дети не совершеннолетние. Она более 16 лет работала бухгалтером в частной организации. Мохина данное время работает официанткой в кафе. Она трудолюбивая и честно выполняет свою работу. Она имеет маленькую зарплату и ели-ели справляется с семейными расходами. Она должна купить школьные формы и школьные принадлежности для своих детей, так как ее дети учатся в средней школе. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Mohina is a conscientious woman. She is 36 years old. She is a widow and is raising her children on her own. She has four children. Her children are still young. For more than 16 years, she worked as an accountant in a private company. Mohina currently works as a server in a cafe. She is hardworking and honest in fulfilling her job.
