She gets a small salary and more or less copes with family expenses. 

She needs to purchase school uniforms and supplies for her children, because they are in high school. 

She is requesting a loan of 1,000 somoni.

loans.use: to buy school uniforms and supplies for her children

loans.name: Violine

texts.en: Violine is 36 years old and married to David; together they are blessed with three children aged between 17 and 8 years. Violine does green tea leaf hawking  in Kaptumo and she is served by Kadet Kapsabet Branch. She has been in this business for the last four years, and from this business she gets a monthly income of Kshs. 10,000. She has borrowed a loan of Kshs. 45,000 which she will use to purchase more green tea leaves for resale. She anticipates getting profits which she will use to expand her business and pay school fees for her children. Her dream is to expand her business to a point that it will be able to make profits that will enable her to have a good life and be stable financially.

loans.use: To buy green tea leaves

loans.name: Celenia

texts.es:
Celenia es una joven 25 años de edad, luchadora, emprendedora ya que desde muy temprana edad se ha dedicado a la agricultura siendo su especialidad el cultivo de café. Ella también cultiva hortalizas en compañía de su esposo ya que día a día se dirigen hasta donde están ubicados sus cultivos donde ambos dan el mantenimiento necesario como la limpieza, poda y la aplicación de fertilizantes. Celenia es madre de 2 hijos los cuales son menores de edad y dependen de ella y su esposo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria incompleto el cual pudo cursar hasta el 5 año. La tierra que en familia trabajan es propia gracias a una herencia por parte de sus padres la cual está ubicada en la misma propiedad donde está su casa da habitación.

Por lo que hoy en día ella no deja de soñar y creer que algún día llegara a extender sus cultivos y a ofrecer mayores cantidades a los compradores que llegan a la zona en busca de un buen producto, higiénico y con un precio en el mercado competitivo para poder generar mayores ingresos para su familia y el bienestar y futuro de sus hijos. Ella solicita un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL con el que comprara 9 unidades de nutricafe, 4 unidades de abono 18-46-0, 2 botes de abono foliar con los que dará mantenimiento y protección a sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Celenia is a young woman, age 25. She is persistent and enterprising because from a very young age she has worked in agriculture, her specialty being the farming of coffee. She also grows vegetables, along with her husband, because everyday they set out to where their crops are located. Together they do the necessary maintenance, such as cleaning, pruning, and applying fertilizer. 

Celenia is the mother of two children, who are minors and depend on her and her husband. She has an incomplete elementary education, because she only managed to study through the fifth year of school. The land her family works is her own thanks to an inheritance from her parents. It is located on the same property as her home.

These days she never stops dreaming and believing that someday she will come to expand her crops and offer larger quantities to the buyers who come to her area looking for a good, hygienic product at a competitive market price. She will be able to generate higher profits for her family and for the wellbeing and future of her children. She is asking COMIXMUL for financing with which she will buy 9 units of nutricafe, 4 units of 18-46-0 fertilizer, and 2 containers of foliage fertilizer. With these she will give protection and maintenance to her crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her crops of vegetables.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 53 years old. He is married with seven adult children. For the past six years, he had run a shop and hotel business. Paul is also a farmer. He earns 50,000 KES each month. 

Paul is requesting a loan to add more stock such as sugar, milk, rice, soap, and flour to sell and also use in his hotel business. He will use the anticipated profit from his loan to expand his hotel by buying more utensils and chairs. This is his sixth loan with KADET LTD. In future, Paul hopes to install electricity in his home compound.

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, rice, soap, and flour to use in his hotel and sell

loans.name: Digna Elizabeth

texts.es:
Digna tiene un grado de educación primario no culminado cursado hasta el tercer grado de primaria ya que sus padres no pudieron apoyarla para que ella pudiese completar sus estudios, es por ello que diariamente en compañía de su compañero de hogar trabajan muy duro para que sus dos hijos tengan mejores oportunidades en el futuro. Ella es agricultora y ama de casa ya que se dedica a la siembra y cultivo de café siendo sus clientes las bodegas, vecinos e intermediarios que llegan a la zona para la adquisición del producto al final de cada cosecha. Sus cultivos están ubicados en la misma propiedad donde ella y su familia habitan por lo que es más fácil su asistencia y mantenimiento.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 3 QQ de formula cafetalera, 2 QQ de fórmula de crecimiento, 4 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0 y 8 QQ de urea. 

Los planes a futuro son los agrandar más sus cultivos de café por medio de la siembra, mejorando y sembrando una variedad diferente del producto como también satisfaciendo algunas necesidades en sus clientes como la demanda que actualmente maneja para dar un mejor servicio y darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y educación.
texts.en:
Digna did not complete primary school; she only got up to third grade because her parents were unable to support her to complete her schooling.  This is why she and her spouse work very hard so that their two children will have better opportunities in future.

She works in agriculture and is also a housewife.  She grows coffee and her customers are stores, neighbors and middlemen who come to the zone to buy the product at the end of each harvest.  Her crops are located on the same property where she and her family live which makes it easier for her to care for and maintain them.

She has requested a loan from the Comixmul cooperative to buy 3 quintals of coffee formula, 2 quintals of growth formula, 4 quintals of 18-46-0 formula and 8 quintals of urea.

Her future plans are to expand her coffee crops by planting more and to improve by planting a different variety of coffee to meet current customer demand and provide better service thus providing better quality of life and education for her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: John

texts.es: John tiene  36 años, esta casado con Ruth y tiene una hija 11 años con quien vive en su casa propia. John se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en un puesto que lograron ocupar dentro del mercado de abastos de su localidad. Lleva mas de 15 años con su negocio y ha logrado convertirlo en un buen sustento para su familia. Día a día reciben la visita de muchos clientes quienes son amas de casa y encargados de restaurantes que llegan a su puesto buscando productos tales como verduras frescas, cereales y demás productos de consumo. Para mantener abastecido su negocio trata de comprar mercadería al por mayor de los productos menos perecibles permitiéndole también obtener buenas ganancias. Tienen el deseo de convertirse en un proveedor mayorista de productos comestibles ya que le generaría mejores ingresos. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 3,500 nuevos soles para la compra de su mercadería al por mayor tales como arroz, azúcar, verduras y conservas enlatadas.
texts.en:
John, 36, is married to Ruth and they have an 11-year-old daughter living with them in his own house.  John works selling food products in a stand they managed to buy in their local wholesale food market.  He’s been in business more than 15 years and has succeeded in turning it into a good source of family support.

He’s visited daily by many customers who are housewives and restaurant managers who come to his stand looking for food products like fresh vegetables, cereals and other consumables.  To keep his store stocked he tries to buy the least perishable merchandise at wholesale in order to earn higher profits.  He wants to become a grocery wholesaler because that will generate higher income.

This is his third Kiva loan and he feels grateful for the financial support he gets to continue forward; he also commits to make his payments punctually.

On this occasion he’d like to have 3,500 new soles to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, vegetables and canned meats at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy food items at wholesale.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 32 years of age, married to Mary, and blessed with four children, aged 12, 9, 7, and 3 years, respectively. He manufactures and sells molasses, a business he started seven years ago and he has steadily expanded his monthly income to KES 220,000, up from KES 70,000. 

Fredrick has requested a third loan, in the amount of KES 100,000, to purchase a pickup truck for transporting molasses. The profit he earns will aid him in purchasing a lorry for transportation. His dream is to become a millionaire.

loans.use: to purchase a pickup truck for transporting molasses.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 57 years old. She operates a fruit and vegetable stall in the outskirts of Narok town in Kenya. She learned about Kadet from a loan officer who was carrying a markerting compaign in her area. Jane has been in this business for eight years and earns a monthly income of approximately 10,000 KES.

She has acquired a first loan of 30,000 KES, which will help her to purchase more fresh fruits and vegetables from farmers. Buying in bulk has proven to be cheaper and enables her to earn more income. She will use the proceeds to repay her loan. Her dream is to own some rental houses.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetable for resale

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 41-year-old single mother of six children, aged 22, 13, 11, 8, 6 and 3 years respectively. She sells grocery goods and charcoal, a business she ventured into ten years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 50,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables and charcoal for sale. The profit from her business will aid her in repaying her loan. Her dream is to excel in her business and better the life of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fruits vegetables and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en: Bahati appreciates the previous loan she got from Kiva. Apart from her water selling business, she also operates a kiosk where she sells various items such as rice, bread, tea leaves and soft drinks. She is requesting for a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase bread, rice and sugar for resale. She thanks Yehu and Kiva for financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bread, rice and sugar for resale

loans.name: Marina Lisbeth

texts.es: Marina es originaria de la ciudad de León.  Es de oficio comerciante, Se dedica a la venta de celulares desde hace tiempo. Cuenta con el apoyo de su mama quien le ha ayudado para el buen funcionamiento de su negocio. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito, ya que con el préstamo anterior logro invertir en productos que sus clientes necesitaban. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar productos tales como: Tarjeta de memoria, celulares, protectores, cables USB, microchip entre otros con el fin de diversificar su negocio. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda ya que aumentara sus ventas y obtendrá mayores ingresos. Su Meta futuro es expandir su negocio y tener varias sucursales.
texts.en:
Marina’s from the city of León.  She’s a merchant by profession.  She’s been selling mobile phones for quite some time.  Her mother helps her to keep the business running well.  She’s grateful to Kiva and to MiCredito because she used her previous loan to buy products her customers needed.

She’s requesting a new loan to buy such things as: memory cards, mobile phones, cases, USB cables and microchips, among others aiming at diversifying her business.  She believes that the loan will be very useful because her sales will increase and she’ll earn higher income.  Her future goal is to expand the business and to open several branches.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories and merchandise.

loans.name: Jose Emilio

texts.es: Jose, tiene 38 años de edad, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Gracias, Lempira.  Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos y actualmente al cultivo de café. La producción que sale es vendida en la misma zona donde vive y es su fuente de ingresos. El solicita un préstamo por 15,000 Lempiras para darle mantenimiento, abonar y fertilizar la finca de café. Tiene como meta a futuro poder comprar tres manzanas más de tierra y  cultivarlas de café para dejarles un buen futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
José, 38, is married with three children.  He lives in Gracias, Lempira.  He’s always worked in agriculture growing basic grains and currently growing coffee.  He sells what he produces in the same zone where he lives and it’s his source of income.

He’s requesting a 15,000 Lempira loan to provide crop maintenance, to fertilize and nourish his coffee plants.  His future goal is to be able to buy three more ‘manzanas’ [Central American unit of land measurement] of land to grow coffee on in order to leave a good future for his children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita tiene  59 años, es viuda y vive sola en su casa de material noble ya que sus hijos son personas independientes y muy trabajadoras. Desde siempre fue muy empeñosa en los oficios que fue desempeñando para mantener a sus hijos a pesar de la irreparable partida de su esposo. Fue así que inicialmente puso una tienda de abarrotes en donde se dedicaba a la venta de productos comestibles al por menor pero tras varios años de trabajo tuvo la suerte de conocer a dos amigos quienes por la confianza y deseo común de superación unieron capitales y fue posible aperturar un taller de carpintería en donde se realiza la construcción de diversos muebles gracias a un maestro carpintero que también contratan. Es un negocio muy rentable según comenta puesto que la madera tiene un precio accesible gracias a los proveedores que traen los bloques de madera hasta la ciudad. A diario, este negocio recibe la visita de distintos clientes quienes encargan la elaboración de camas, roperos, cómodas, banquitos; entre otros. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para la compra de bloques de madera y concretar pedidos pendientes que tiene dentro de los cuales esta la construcción de banquitos para el centro educativo inicial  de su localidad.
texts.en:
Margarita is 59 years old. She is a widow and lives alone in her house made of superior materials because her children are hardworking people living on their own. She has always been very diligent in the duties she carried out to support her children in spite of the irreparable departure of her husband. It was thus that she initially opened a convenience store where she sold groceries, but after various years of work she had the luck of meeting two friends. Because of their mutual trust and a common desire to improve their situations, they pooled their money and it was possible for them to open a carpentry workshop where various furniture items could be made thanks to a master carpenter they also hired. According to her, it is a very profitable business, given that wood is cheap thanks to the dealers who bring wooden blocks to the city.  Everyday this business receives visits from various customers who order beds, wardrobes, dressers, and stools, among other products.

This is her third loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she receives to get ahead. Additionally, she is committed to making her payments on time. At this time, she would like 2,000 nuevos soles to buy blocks of wood and to settle pending orders that she has. Among these is the construction of stools for the first education center in her area.

loans.use: to buy wooden blocks.

loans.name: Reyna

texts.es:
La señora Reyna es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijas y su esposo en una comunidad en la zona sur  de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta y elaboración de tortillas el cual es muy conocido en su colonia. 
Doña Reyna necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz, cal y leña. Los cuales  necesita para seguir elaborando su  producto. Ella espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con  la  materia  prima  necesaria  para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia.
Doña Reyna espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la colonia y de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  sus hijas continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Agosto del  2013
texts.en:
Reyna is a very hardworking, responsible woman living with her daughters and her husband in a community in southern Honduras.  Her business is making and selling tortillas; it’s very well-known in her neighborhood.

Reyna needs a loan to buy corn, lime powder and firewood that are needed for her to be able to continue making her product.  She hopes that thanks to the loan she’ll have necessary raw materials on-hand to stay in business and meet customer demand.  At the same time, she hopes an increase in sales will be reflected in improved family quality of life.

Reyna hopes her business will continue to grow and become the best-known in the neighborhood so that she can continue supporting her family and her daughters can continue with their schooling and have better life opportunities.


Choluteca, Honduras – August,    2013

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder and firewood.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more Japan surplus products like different kinds of vases, cabinets, etc.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 33 years old and a beautician.  She is married to John, a businessman. Their marriage is blessed with three children. 

Naomi has been running her salon for the past three years with a monthly income of KSH 10,000, which she uses to provide for her family. 

Naomi is applying for her fourth loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully. Naomi will use the loan to service her vehicle and buy more beauty products. With the expected profit from the business, she will expand her business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to improve on the living standards of her business.

loans.use: To service her vehicle and buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
This is Joan. She previously accessed an 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase scrap materials needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund to buy scrap and recyclable materials. 

Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Joan hopes to be more successful in her business and dreams of giving her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their work every week.  There she can draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans

loans.use: to pay for scrap and recyclable materials.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a 59-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four grown children. She provides tailoring services. She makes dresses and does dress alterations. She has been doing this for almost 10 years. She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy spare parts for her sewing machine, to pay the labor fees for repairing her sewing machine, and to buy food for the family. This will help Brenda improve her services and provide capital to continue operating her business. In the future, Brenda hopes to accommodate all her customers' needs and to save for old age.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and to pay repair fees for her sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Lucia Guillermina

texts.es:
La señora Lucia Guillermina  de 51 años de edad,  no tiene  hijos  que dependen  de ella, vive con su esposo en su casa propia,  ubicada en la comunidad  San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Lucia Guillermina se dedica desde hace 16 años al negocio de venta de tortillas, ella vende las tortillas a un restaurante de la zona y también atiende a los vecinos que llegan a moler el maíz a su molino.
Doña Lucia Guillermina está solicitando el préstamo para compra  de una lancha pequeña ya que tiene el motor y quiere que su hijo trabaje pescando en el mar y trayendo leña seca del mar para luego venderla y así tener más ingresos para ayudar en la casa, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Doña Lucia su sueño para este año es comprarse esa lancha.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto  del 2013
texts.en:
Lucia Guillermina is 51 years old. She doesn't have any children who depend on her, and she lives with her husband in her own house, which is located in the community of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. 

Lucia Guillermina has been making her living selling tortillas for the last 16 years. She sells her tortillas to a restaurant in her area and also serves her neighbors who come to grind corn at her mill.

Lucia Guillermina is seeking a loan to buy a small motorboat. She wants her son to fish in the sea and to bring back dry firewood from the sea to sell, in order to obtain a higher income to help with household expenses. She is very happy to continue working with Prisma. Lucia says her dream for this year is to buy a boat.

loans.use: to buy a boat for her business.

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en:
Marietta is proud to share that, through her husband's source of income, they are able to send their children to school. 

Marietta is into a direct-selling business of clothes, shoes, fragrances, and beauty products. She earns 25% or more from the items she sells. She is rounding her business in her village and asks for her customers' orders and then delivers them as her way of gaining profit.

Two of their three children have already finished college and work as seamen. Marietta wants her youngest child to be similar to her other two children. She keeps on selling to gain income and be able to finance her child's education. Marietta is determined to earn more income. That’s why she encourages many customers. 

In this regard, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase her customers' orders, like shoes, clothes, and fragrances. She hopes to gain higher income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase her customers' orders, like shoes, clothes, and fragrances.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 58-year-old man from Nakuru. He is married to Susan, who is a housewife. They have five children, who are 21, 19, 16, 13 and 8 years old.

He operates a business of selling farm produce (such as potatoes) and charcoal. He has been running this business for the past 10 years. Edward's currently monthly income is approximately 10,000 KES.

Edward has applied for his second loan from Kadet Ltd. in the amount of 20,000 KES to enable him to buy more inventory for his business and to improve his farming activities by buying seeds and fertilizers. His plan is to use the profits he expects to generate as a result of the loan to build some rental houses on a plot of land that he owns. In the future, Edward hopes that his business will grow to greater heights and that his family will be healthy and happy.

loans.use: To expand and improve his business by purchasing additional inventory (produce and charcoal) for re-sale purposes and seeds and fertilizers for farming operations

loans.name: Candida

texts.es:
La  Señora Cándida de 22 años, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en el Barrio las Brisas, en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde hace 05 años a la actividad que es la venta de  calzado como ser tenis, sandalias, sandalias de niña, tenis de niño, zapatos colegiales, tenis de señora, sus ventas son de lunes a domingo.
Doña Cándida tiene su puesto del mercado municipal en donde llega a vender todos los días de la semana y tienen sus clientes que solo le llegan a comprar.
Doña Cándida está solicitando 5,000.00 lempiras para compra de más mercadería blusas, pantalones, camisas y zapatos  ya que quiere surtir más su negocio y así salir a vender ya que quiere aprovechar la temporada de las fiestas patrias.
Doña Cándida su sueño es ampliar mas su casa y su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Cándida, 22, lives at home in the Brisas neighborhood in the southern part of Honduras.  For five years she has been selling shoes such as girls' sandals, boys' tennis shoes, school shoes and women's tennis shoes.  She works from Monday through Sunday.

Cándida has a stall at the municipal market where she sells every day of the week and attends to her loyal customers.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 5,000 HNL to buy merchandise such as blouses, pants, shirts and shoes because she wants to stock her business for the national holiday season.

Cándida's dream is to expand her house and her business.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - August, 2013.

loans.use: To buy blouses, pants, shirts and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en:
Ma. Lilibeth is a 35-year-old married woman with two children. One of her children is in school.

She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, which she has operated for four years.

Ma. Lilibeth is requesting a loan through NWTH in the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy ingredients for her food production business. She hopes that the loan will enable her to expand and improve her business so that she can secure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to further expand her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., clothing, footwear, and cosmetics)

loans.name: Maria Salvadora

texts.es: Doña María de 65 años de edad, vive en casa de un familiar junto a su familia, Ella se dedica a la elaboración de canastos artesanales desde hace mas de 12 años poseen gran demanda por sus productos ya que no son muy comunes en la zona donde ella reside, es una persona humilde, trabajadora, responsable, luchadora y con ganas de sacar a su familia adelante, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Doña María solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para poder seguir elaborando sus productos, abasteciendo su demanda ya que posee clientela establecida y mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María is 65 years old and lives in her family's house.  She has worked making handmade baskets for more than 12 years.  They are in high demand, since they aren't very common where she lives.  She is a humble, hardworking, responsible, and perseverant person who desires to help her family progress.  In this way, she has been able to cover many of the family expenses.

María is asking for a loan to buy raw materials so she can continue to make her products and meet her demand.  She has an established clientele and hopes to improve her income and also improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy bamboo wholesale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 36-year-old shopkeeper. She is married to Kennedy. They are blessed with one child. Rose has been running a retail shop for the past three years and earns a monthly income of 30,000 KES, which she uses to provide for her family. 

Rose is applying for her first loan with KADET. She will use the loan to expand her business to the wholesale market. With the anticipated profits from the business, she will pay school fees for her children and invest in another type of business. 

Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and have a sustainable business.

loans.use: To expand her business into the wholesale market.

loans.name: Avelino

texts.es:
Avelino, de 43 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de su esposa e hijos en su casa propia, donde vive desde que nació. Durante la mañana, desde muy temprano. Avelino se dedica al cultivo de diversos productos agrícolas como maíz y papa, que son su principal sustento económico. Gusta de cultivar y mantener los surcos de sus sembríos alineados y en buen estado de esa manera, asegura una buena cosecha, con productos de primera calidad. Además de ser una de las personas más carismáticas y en la negociación de sus cultivos constantemente recibe buenas utilidades, por ese poder de negociación. Además cuenta que desea mejorar sus ganancias para poder comprar nuevos terrenos agrícolas. Sabe que lo conseguirá pues tiene la convicción de mejorar sus sembríos y de trabajar sin cansancio. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, esta muy contento de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos.
Avelino, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Avelino, age 43, is a responsible man.  He resides with his wife and children in the same house that he has lived in since he was born.  In the early morning hours, Avelino begins to look after his various crops, such as corn and potatoes, which are his main source of income.  He enjoys cultivating his crops and keeping the furrows properly aligned so that the plants remain in good condition.  This ensures a good harvest of products that are of the highest quality.  

Avelino is known for being one of the most charismatic individuals, which helps him in negotiating the price of his crops and with always obtaining the highest profits.  He also wants to improve his income by purchasing additional plots of farmland.  In order to succeed, Avelino knows that he must improve his crops and work tirelessly.  

This is his second Kiva loan.  He is very pleased to have this financial support and has always proven that he is responsible with his payments.  Avelino will invest the money in the purchase of organic fertilizer for nourishing his crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Clever

texts.es:
Clever, de 40 años,está casado con Elisa y tiene 02 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Clever se dedica a la venta de repuestos de vehículos en general tales como llantas, engranajes, rodajes, entre otros. Durante mucho tiempo sufrió algunos contratiempos en su vida por la situación de su ciudad pero hace 10 años decidió empezar un nuevo proyecto con ganas de sobresalir y decidió por la venta de repuestos al ver que los dueños de las distintas movilidades iban a otra ciudad a comprar estos productos. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener tiempo para poder estar al cuidado de su vivienda, además que desde que empezó con su negocio le está yendo bien en su economía, ya que tiene ingresos para su hogar y desea seguir creciendo más con su negocio.
Este es su primer crédito con Kiva, por ello espera de su apoyo financiero para continuar con sus objetivos,además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.600 soles comprará llantas, engranajes, rodajes, entre otros.
texts.en:
Clever, 40, is married to Elisa and they have two children who live with them in their own home.  Clever sells auto spare parts such as tires, gears, bearings, etc.  For a long time he had to face several obstacles in his life because of the situation in the city, but ten years ago he decided to begin a new project in an effort to get ahead.  Seeing that people driving vehicles were going to other cities for their products he decided to open a spare parts business.  He enjoys his work since it allows him time to take care of his home.  Since starting his business his economy is doing better as he earns an income for the household and wants to expand the business.

This is his first Kiva loan and he is counting on your financial support to continue toward his goal.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time.  He plans to use the 600 PEN to buy tires, gears, bearings, etc.

loans.use: To buy spare parts such as tires, gears, etc.

loans.name: Elba Maria

texts.es: Doña Elba es originaria de la ciudad de Granada. Tiene 51 años de edad, casada y madre 5 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de productos Herbalife desde hace tiempo. Agradece a Kiva y MiCredito por el apoyo que le han brindado, ya que a través del préstamo anterior logro aumentar sus ventas y obtener mayores ingresos. Solicita este nuevo  crédito para comprar: proteínas, aloe vera de sabor, oxigenador, gel limpiador, multivitaminas entre otros con el fin de satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda para mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que al comprar al por mayor ella adquiere un porcentaje de ganancias.
texts.en:
Elba is originally from Granada.  She is 51 years old, is married, and has 5 children.  She is a businesswomen and has worked selling Herbalife products for some time.

She is thankful to Kiva and MiCredito for the support that they have given her, since through her previous loan she was able to increase her sales and obtain higher income.

She is asking for a new loan to buy protein, scented aloe vera, oxigenator, cleaning gel, multivitamins, and other things.  In this way, she will satisfy the needs of her customers.  She believes that the loan will be a great help for her in terms of improving her quality of life, since by buying wholesale she will keep for herself a proportion of the profits.

loans.use: buy protein, scented aloe vera, oxigenator, gel cleaner, multivitamins, etc.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 46-year-old widow. She supports a family of six people.

To earn a living, she runs a shoe shop in the Kipture trading center. She has been in this line of business for two years. She also does small-scale mixed farming to generate additional income. From these businesses she typically earns a profit of approximately 20,000 KES every month.

She is now seeking a second loan from Kadet. She plans to use 60,000 KES of the 100,000 KES she is seeking to purchase shoes for re-sale; and she would like to use the remaining loan proceeds to pay for her children’s school fees. The profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan will be used to pay for her children’s school fees and to expand her business. Her dream is to expand her business and to educate her children to the highest possible level.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing shoes for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Margoth

texts.es: Margoth tiene  39 años, está casada con Alipio y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Margoth tiene una tienda dedicada a la venta de calzados y prendas de vestir en el mercado de su localidad donde diariamente recibe la visita de sus clientes quienes en su mayoría son personas del campo. Se inicio hace más de 10 años como vendedora ambulante, recorriendo incluso varios de los anexos de su zona llegando a vender inicialmente solo zapatillas de lona y botas para el trabajo agrícola. Tiempo después y logrando reunir una buena cantidad de dinero rentó un establecimiento para poner su tienda contando siempre con el apoyo de su esposo. Le gusta mantener su negocio bien surtido y con modelos modernos. Le agrada trabajar los fines de semana ya que son los días en donde reciba un mayor número de clientes quienes incluso son vendedores minoristas que le compran una buena cantidad de sus productos. Este es su tercer préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta oportunidad desea contar con 3,500 nuevos soles para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio con la compra de calzados al por mayor, sandalias y zapatillas de lona.
texts.en:
Margoth is 39.  She has a husband, Alipio, and two children, with with whom she lives in her own house.  She has a store  in the town market where she sells shoes and clothing.  Every day she receives customers, most of whom are from the country.  She started out more than 10 years ago as a traveling salesperson, going to the surrounding areas, at first selling only farmers' work boots and canvas sneakers.  Later on when she had a good bit of money she rented out a locale for her store, always with her husband's support.   She likes working weekends because that's when she gets the most customers, including retailers who buy quite a few of her products.  

This is Margoth's third Kiva loan and she's grateful for the financial help she gets so she can get ahead.   She promises to make her payments on time.  At this time she would like a loan of 3,500 soles to increase her inventory by purchasing sandals and canvas sneakers wholesale.

loans.use: to buy sneakers and sandals wholesale.

loans.name: Glendy Merary

texts.es:
Glendy es una joven de 30 años de edad ella es madre soltera con una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora la cual viaja en autobús hasta uno de sus lugares de trabajo aproximadamente a 200 km de su casa de habitación para darle el sustento a su hija la cual está en la escuela ya que ella trabaja como operaria en una maquila y en mientras no está en la maquila trabaja en el campo junto a su hermano. El apoyo que ella tiene es su madre que cuida a su hija en su ausencia y su hermano se encarga de dar el mantenimiento y tecnificación a sus cultivos de café mientras ella está en el trabajo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo y su madre y su hermano viven en su casa de habitación. Fue su madre quien le enseño a trabajar la tierra hace algún tiempo atrás y el terreno que ella y su hermano trabajan es propio gracias a una herencia familiar por parte de su madre.

Sus sueños para el futuro es estudiar una carrera universitaria que le permita implementar sus conocimientos en la agricultura y que le ayude a mejorar la producción y tecnificación para sus cultivos que son un medio más de sustento que ella y su familia tienen para cubrir los diferentes gastos que se dan en su casa de habitación. Por lo que hoy en día ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 6 bolsas de nutricafe, 6 bolsas de fórmula 18-46-0, 6 bolsas de urea, 6 bolsas de abono foliar y 2 litros de ALTO 10 SL con lo que podrá asistir sus cultivos y tener al final de la temporada una buena cosecha para su venta.
texts.en:
Glendy, 30, is a single mother and a hard-working entrepreneur who travels by bus to her place of work which is about 200 kilometers from home.  This is so she can provide for her daughter who attends school.  Glendy works as a factory operator and her brother takes care of maintaining and providing technical assistance to the coffee crop while she is working.  She completed her primary education and her mother and brother live with her at home.  Her mother is the one who taught her about agriculture some time ago.  Glendy and her brother own the land since they inherited from their mother's family.

Her dream for the future is to get a university degree corresponding to her agricultural knowledge.  This will help her improve production and technical aspects of her crop growing since it is the main source of income for her and her family.  She is requesting a loan through COMIXMUL to buy six bags of Nutricafe, six bags of Formula 18-46-0, six bags of urea, six bags of fertilizer and two liters of ALTO 10 SL.  These products will help her crop produce a good harvest.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: Doña María de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos que estudian actualmente, Ella posee una tienda y una pupuseria desde hace varios años, su negocio posee mucha clientela que demanda sus productos, es una persona muy honesta, trabajadora, servicial y con muy buenas referencias, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos, Doña maría solicita un crédito para  invertir en su negocio de tienda en comprar de golosinas, huevos, granos básicos,  etc. para poder abastecer la gran demanda que posee y obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María, 39, lives in her own house with her two school-aged children.  She has a store and a "pupuseria" (stuffed tortilla stand) and has been in business for several years.  She has many customers who prefer her products since she is a very honest, hard-working, service oriented person with very good references.  Through her business she has been able to cover her expenses.  

María is requesting a loan to buy sweets, eggs, staple goods, etc. to be able to fill the current demand and increase her income which will improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To buy sweets, eggs, staples, etc.

loans.name: Jenny Angelica

texts.es: La Sra. Jenny tiene 45 años, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Villa el Carmen, al norte  de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Jenny enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Jenny, 45, sells essential items at her neighborhood store located in the area of Villa el Carmen in the northern part of the city of La Paz.  This is her first loan through the institution and she plans to use it to buy goods for her store such as groceries, sweets and soft drinks.  The reason she is requesting the loan is the high demand she is experiencing, so sales volume will increase by having more stock on hand. 

Jenny is up against competition in the area because there are several stores nearby.  She will use her profits to buy more products for the store so she can continue growing on a daily basis and increase her income.  This will improve her and her family's lifestyle.  She is content and grateful to the institution for the support.

loans.use: To buy goods for her business.

loans.name: Joel Adonay

texts.es: Don Joel de 45 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, él se dedica a prestar servicios de transporte desde hace varios años, es muy reconocido en la zona donde labora lo cual lo ha llevado a obtener una numerosa clientela ya establecida que siempre lo buscan por su responsabilidad a la hora de manejar, es una persona honesta, responsable y muy atenta con sus clientes , gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos, Don Joel solicita un crédito para invertir en el mantenimiento y compra de repuestos para vehículo ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo, y de esta manera ofrecer sus servicios en un vehiculo en las mejores condiciones, y así obtener mayores ingresos y ofrecerle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
Joel is 45 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children.  He has worked in transportation for several years and is very well-known in the area where he works.  This has allowed him to obtain a large, established clientele that always looks to him because of his dependability when it comes time to drive.

He is honest, responsible, and attentive to his customers.  Thanks to his work, he has been able to cover many of his expenses.

Joel is asking for a loan to invest in the maintenance of his vehicle, since it is his only source of income.  He will also buy spare parts.  In this way, he will be able to offer his services in a vehicle that is in the best condition possible.  In this way, he will obtain greater income and offer his family the quality of life that they deserve.

loans.use: buy spare parts and service his vehicle.

loans.name: Ma. Junita

texts.en:
Ma. Junita is 49 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Junita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Junita has been raising pigs for five years and earns additional income from buying and selling bananas.

Ma. Junita successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 52-year-old married man who supports a family of seven. The family has been blessed with six children between the ages of  10 and 20 years old. James' primary daily earnings come from a quarry which has been in operation for more than 5 years. He earns an income of 30,000 KES.

He has borrowed a loan of 30,000 KES from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase tools and equipment to use in the quarry. The profit he earns will be used to repay the loan and pay school fees.

His dream is to expand his quarry to earn a better living.

loans.use: To purchase tools and equipment.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a married man, age 26 and blessed with a one year old. He supports a family of three members. He owns a food cafe in Eldama ravine and has been in the business for three years, earning an income of KES 15,000 monthly.

He joined a self-help group and is now servicing his first loan of KES 20,000. With the money, Jacob intends to purchase stocks of cooking fat, sugar, salt, wheat flour. etc. for his business. The anticipated amounts will be used to repay the loan.

His hope is to expand his current business for a better living.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of cooking fat, sugar, salt, and wheat flour, etc. for his food cafe.

loans.name: Kanadzina

texts.en:
Kanadzina is a married woman, with seven children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Kanadzina sells coconut fruits to passersby and her neighbors and she has been in this business for the past two years. She cited seasonality as her major challenge. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale. She joined Yehu Microfinance Trust to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for resale.

loans.name: Mercyline

texts.en:
Mercyline is a married woman who lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mercyline sells fruits, such as oranges, coconuts, and bananas. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase fruits, such as coconuts, oranges, and bananas for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, such as coconuts, oranges, and bananas for her business.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a sewing business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, buttons, etc. for her sewing business. Merlina has been in this business for 25 years. She earns additional income from food vending.

Merlina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fabric, thread, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Evangelina

texts.es:
Evangelina es una mujer muy trabajadora, desde pequeña se desempeña en los oficios domésticos y la agricultura ya que fueron sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar la tierra. En el estudio ella solo pudo cursar hasta el tercer grado ya sus padres no pudieron apoyarla económica mente. Ella es madre de 5 hijos y diariamente lucha en compañía de su esposo para vestirles, calzarlos, alimentarlos y facilitarle lo que ellos necesiten y ellos como padres puedan darles. 4 de ellos están en la escuela estudiando en diferentes grados de educación y el menor de todos en casa. Ella sueña con el futuro de sus hijos y verlos convertidos en adultos y profesionales es su meta, como también poder cultivar más producto en su tierra, una mejor variedad, más atractiva para sus clientes que les genera mayores ingresos para poder cumplir sus metas y sueños.

Es por ello que hoy en día ella está solicitando un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para la compra de 4 QQ de nutricafe, 6 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0, 3 QQ de urea, 4 QQ de abono foliar, 2 litros de ALTO 10 SL, 3 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 4 QQ de formula cafetalera con lo que asistirá sus cultivos y asegurara su cosecha.
texts.en:
Evangelina is a very hardworking woman, and has been carrying out both domestic and farming chores since she was young.  Her parents were the ones who taught her to work the land.  She could only study until the third grade because her parents were unable to support her economically.

She is the mother of five children.  She fights, along with her husband, every day in order to dress them, give them shoes, feed them, and provide them with everything they need that she and her husband, as their parents, are able to give them.  Four of her children are studying in school and are in different grades; her youngest son is too small and is still at home.  

She dreams of her children's futures, and of seeing them become adults and professionals.  She also hopes to be able to grow more crops on her land, and to grow a greater variety of crops, which is more attractive to her customers.  This would allow her to generate more income so that she can achieve her goals and dreams.

For these reasons, she is requesting financing today from Comixmul.  She will buy four quintals of organic coffee, six quintals of 18-46-0 fertilizer, three quintals of urea, four quintals of foliar fertilizer, two liters of fungicide, three quintals of 12-24-12 fertilizer, and four quintals of a special fertilizer specifically for coffee plants.  These supplies will help her crops and will ensure a good harvest.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Diorica

texts.es: Diorica tiene 25 años de edad, vive acompañada de su esposo y sus hijos en la casa de sus suegros. Su principal actividad económica se centra en la venta de productos comestibles , hace 2 años que se dedica a este negocio, además como actividad complementaria se dedica a la atención y venta de repuestos en un taller. Al inicio con lo que ganaba no le alcanzaba para suplir las necesidades de su familia, es así que decide poner a la venta en el mismo local, gaseosas, refrescos, keke y variedades de golosina, del cual percibe un ingreso extra que le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos y por lo tanto su nivel de vida. Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para su desempeño laboral. El dinero solicitado de S/.1000.00 lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas, keke y golosinas para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Diorica is 25 years old.  She lives with her husband and her children in her in-laws' house.  Her primary economic activity is the sale of food items.  She has had this business for 2 years.  As a complementary activity, she services and sells spare parts in a repair shop.

At first, what she earned was not sufficient to meet her family's needs.  That is how she decided to start selling sodas, soft drinks, cakes and various snacks at the same store.  She receives extra income from this that helps her to improve her earnings and also her standard of living.

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is very grateful for the opportunity to get a line of credit, which will be very useful to her business performance.  She will invest the amount requested of 1000.00 soles in the purchase of soft drinks, cakes and snacks to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy food items such as soft drinks, cakes and snacks to stock her business.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 51-year-old farmer. He is married to Beth. They are blessed with three children. Simon has been farming for the past twenty-five years, with a monthly income of KES 12,000, which he uses to provide for his family. 

Simon is applying for his sixth loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loans successfully and comfortably. Simon will use the loan to buy manure, fertilizer, seedlings, etc. 

With the expected profit from his farm, he will invest in the transport industry. 

His hopes and dreams are to have a sustainable and profitable farm.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer, seedlings, etc.

loans.name: Marylyn

texts.en:
Marylyn is 44 years old and married. She is blessed to have a spouse who is a businessman and hence brings in additional income for the family. Together, they are also blessed with children between the ages of 3 and 20 years old. Marylyn runs a retail shop in Eldama Ravine, which has been in operation for three years. She earns an income of 20,000 KES.

She is now servicing her second loan of 50,000 KES from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to pay school fees for her children. The profits she earns from her shop will be used to repay the loan and also pay school fees.

Her dream is to be a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 57 años de edad, vive en su casa propia acompañada de su esposo, de sus hijos y de sus nietos. Siendo sus hijos ya independientes. Rosario se dedica a la compra-venta de ropa de manera ambulatoria ya que no cuenta con un local fijo para que realice su actividad, ya lleva 5 años en este negocio y se inicio en está actividad con el fin de generar ingresos para su familia y apoyar con los gastos a su esposo, es así que durante muchos años de experiencia, Rosario tiene ahora un negocio estable y rentable. En el futuro piensa ampliar y adquirir un local para su negocio y así mismo aumentar sus ventas para tener más ingresos. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante. El dinero solicitado de S/.500.00 lo invertirá en la compra de ropa al por mayor para dinamizar sus ventas.
texts.en: Rosario is 57 years old.  She lives in her own house alongside her husband, children, and grandchildren.  With her children now independent, Rosario makes a living buying and selling clothes.  She is a street vendor as she has no fixed premises for this work.  Rosario has had the business for five years, having started with the aim of generating an income for her family and to help her husband cover costs.  Now, with many years experience, Rosario has a stable and profitable business.  In the future she wants to expand the business and have premises for it.  In addition she wants to increase her sales in order to have a higher income.  This is Rosario's first loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is receiving to help move forward.  Rosario is applying for a loan of 500 Nuevo Soles, which she will invest in buying clothes in bulk in order to improve her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Luz De Fátima

texts.es:
Doña Luz de Fátima es originaria del municipio de El Sauce donde nació y creció en el núcleo de una familia ganadera, características de los pobladores de este municipio.
Es casada con dos hijos en edad escolar. Su negocio consiste en elaborar comida rápida como enchiladas, tajadas, pollo, tacos, refrescos, brindando este servicio en el cafetín de un colegio de secundaria donde la mayoría de los estudiantes y maestros son sus clientes.
Debido a la temporada se presentó a la oficina de Ceprodel en busca de un financiamiento de los inversionistas de Kiva con el fin de comprar arroz, pollo, carne de cerdo, frijoles, frutas, repollos, tomates, cebolla, salsa, aceite y azúcar y así poder elaborar variedad de comida para atraer y satisfacer a sus clientes, ya que de esto depende en gran medida que su negocio crezca y se mantenga por largo tiempo.
Una de sus grandes ventajas es que atiende a sus clientes con paciencia y buena atención lo que la hace especial.
Doña Luz trabaja en conjunto con uno de sus hijos que le ayuda a vender en el negocio.
Agradece a los inversionistas de Kiva y Ceprodel porque le han apoyado con estos créditos con los cuales ha mantenido su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Luz de Fátima hails from the municipality of El Sauce, where she was born and raised at the heart of a ranching family, characteristic of the inhabitants of this municipality.  She is married with two school-age children.  

Her business consists of making fast food such as enchiladas, fried plantains, chicken, tacos and soft drinks.  She offers this service in the cafeteria of a secondary school where the majority of the students and teachers are her customers.

Because of the season, she went to the office of Ceprodel in search of a loan from Kiva investors for the purpose of buying rice, chicken, pork, beans, fruits, cabbages, tomatoes, onions, sauce, oil and sugar, in order to be able to make a variety of food to attract and satisfy her customers.  Her business depends on this in order to grow and sustain itself for a long time.

One of her greatest advantages is that she attends to her customers with patience and good service, which makes her special.  Luz works with one of her children, who helps her to sell.

She is grateful to the Kiva and Ceprodel investors because they have supported her with these loans with which she has maintained her working capital.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, pork, beans, fruits, cabbages, tomatoes, onions, sauce, oil and sugar.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is from Iraq. He is a youth client who is 26 years old. He is married and is a father of a child. Ahmad is the only provider for his family. 

Ahmad is a motorcycle mechanic who also sells engines and other spare parts for motorcycles. He established his business in 2005. He has good experience in this field and he is well-known in the surrounding area, with an excellent reputation. 

Ahmad is requesting a youth loan of USD 3,000 in order to renovate his shop and install a ceiling. He aims to grow his business and increase his profits, so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and install a ceiling.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josephine is 30 years old and a mixed farmer. She is married to Mwangangi. They are blessed with three children. Josephine has been farming for the past five years and earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES, which she uses to support her family. 

Josephine is applying for her first loan term with KADET. Josephine will use the loan to buy livestock for resale. With the expected profit from the business she will repay the loan and pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to start a butchery and to give her children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy livestock for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old and a farmer. He is married to Agnes, who practices horticulture. They are blessed with two children. John has been farming for the past three years, with a monthly income of KES 3,700, which he uses for his family’s upkeep. 

John is applying for his second loan term with Kenya Agency for Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET), after successfully repaying the previous loan. He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings. 

With the expected profit from his farm, John will expand his farming to large-scale farming. His hope and dream is to be a large-scale farmer in horticulture.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing, wallets, creams, and shoes.

loans.name: Claudia Maribel

texts.es: Doña Claudia vive en casa propia junto a sus padres y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos desde hace más de 8 años es una persona muy amable, honesta, y dedicada a sus labores, posee una gran clientela que demanda sus productos ya que vende en una zona muy transitada y esto se convierte en una ventaja para incrementar su nivel de ventas. Ella solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio, comprar más mercadería por mayor, para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Claudia lives in her own house with her parents and her two children.  She has worked selling clothes and shoes for more than 8 years.  She is friendly, honest, and dedicated to her work.  She has a large clientele that place her products on high demand since she sells in an area that is very busy.  This becomes an advantage to her and helps her increase her sales.

She is asking for a loan to invest in her business by buying wholesale merchandise.  In this way, she will be able to increase her income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: buy more wholesale clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Maria de 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, guineos y a la venta de frutas, desde hace varios años. Ella es una persona honesta, amable y muy responsable, además muy atenta con sus clientes, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Ella solicita un crédito para la compra  de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, semillas, etc. para seguir con su trabajo y  poder mejorar su calidad de vida y mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria is 48 years old and lives in her own house with her two children.  She has worked growing corn and bananas and selling the fruit.  She is honest, friendly, and very responsible.  In addition, she is very attentive to her customers.  In this way, she has been able to cover many of her family expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc.  In this way, she can continue her work and be able to improve her quality of life and her income.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, manure, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia, junto a su compañera de vida y a su hija de 3 años de edad, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol y maicillo desde hace 6 años es una persona responsable y con muy buen carácter, sus cultivos son muy demandados en la zona, de esta manera ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos, el cliente solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, herbicidas,  etc. para aumentar sus cosechas y obtener mayores ganancias y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: This borrower lives in his own house, with his partner and three-year-old daughter.  He has been making a living growing corn, beans and sorghum for six years.  The small-business owner is responsible and a good person.  His crops are much sought after in the area and, as a result, the borrower has been able to cover some costs.  The borrower is applying for a loan to buy farming supplies such as seeds, manure, fertiliser, herbicides and more, in order to increase his harvests and earn higher profits.  With this he will be able to improve his and his family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds, manure, fertiliser, herbicides and more.

loans.name: Silvia Yaneth

texts.es: Doña Silvia de 31 años de edad, es madre soltera vive en casa de un familiar, junto a su hijo de 9 años de edad el cual estudia actualmente, Ella se dedica a la venta de antojitos desde más de 8 años es una persona trabajadora, honrada y muy responsable, su negocio tiene mucha demanda gracias a la calidad con la que elabora sus productos además por la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes, gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos familiares, Doña Silvia solicita un crédito para el mejoramiento de su negocio comprar mesa, bancas y un toldo para el negocio, y poder ofrecerle a sus clientes un establecimiento más agradable, así mejorar su nivel de ventas, obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Silvia, 31, is a single mother who lives in a relative's home together with her nine-year-old son who is currently studying. Silvia has been making her living selling snacks for more than eight years. She is a very hardworking, honorable and responsible person. Her business has high demand thanks to the quality of the products she makes, as well as the friendly way she treats her customers. It is thanks to her work that she has managed to pay off some of her family debts. 

Silvia is seeking a loan to improve her business: to buy a table, benches and an awning for her business and to provide a more pleasant shop for her customers, therein improve her sales, obtain larger profits and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a table, chairs and an awning.

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es: Don de 65 años de edad es una persona trabajadora y  responsable, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, hace varios años se dedica a la elaboración y venta de calzado su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por su buen trabajo y los precio tan accesible, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don José solicita un crédito para la compra de materia prima para su negocio cuero, suelas, pegamento, etc.  Con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José, 65, is hardworking and responsible. He lives with his family in his own house. He has made and sold footwear for some years from his house. He has a solid customer base because his workmanship is good and his prices are affordable. The business allows him to pay some household expenses. José has applied for a loan to buy business supplies such as leather, soles, and glue so that he can raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy leather, soles, glue, etc.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andrés, de 68 años de edad, está casado con Rosa quien es madre de sus hijos los cuales ya son independientes.  Vive junto a su esposa cómodamente en su casa propia. Andrés se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles en su tienda la cual siempre se encuentra abierta desde muy temprano, es por eso que sus múltiples clientes van en busca de algún artículo o producto de primera necesidad ya que saben que lo encontraran y que serán atendidos con una amplia sonrisa y un buen trato.  Su negocio está ubicado en un espacio que acondiciono en su casa, atendiendo ahi desde hace 08 años. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Le gusta su negocio pues no tiene que salir mucho de casa  y puede apoyar a su esposa con lo que necesite. Agradece mucho  el apoyo que le brinda su esposa,  quien está siempre a su lado para ayudarle algunas veces en la atención de sus clientes, ahora desea seguir trabajando mucho y poder comenzar a ampliar y ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Con el monto solicitado de S/.3000 soles, comprará productos y mercadería como arroz, azúcar, aceites, golosinas, bebidas gasificadas entre otros, para poder ofrecer en mayor cantidad y variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Andés is 68 years old and is married to Rosa, who is the mother of their grown children.  He lives comfortably with his wife in their own house.  Andrés works selling food products at his store.  His store is always open starting very early in the morning.  For this reason, his many customers come to him when they need something such as a basic staple food.  They know that they will find him there and that he will be assist them with a big smile and good treatment.

His business is located in an area of his house that he prepared for his business and he has been running it for 8 years.  He thinks that his business has been very fruitful due to the good profits that it gives him.  He likes his business because he doesn't have to leave his house very much and he can help his wife with what she needs.  He is very thankful to the support that his wife gives him.  She is always by his side to help him with his customers.  

Now, he wants to continue to work hard and be able to start expanding and offering a greater variety of goods.  In addition, he promises to make his payments on time.  With the loan (3,000 sols), he will buy goods and merchandise such as rice, sugar, oils, sweets, and carbonated drinks.  In this way, he will be able to offer his customers more goods with greater variety.

loans.use: buy food products such as rice, sugar, oils, sweets, carbonated drinks, and other things.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking woman who lives in Kaloleni, Kenya. She wants to start a new business of selling charcoal. She believes that the business will enable her to get more profits and increase her monthly income.

She is requesting a loan of KSH 50,000 to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal to start a new business.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has six children. Hasan, along with four of his children, provide the family income together, while the other two children continue their studies.

Hasan owns a shop where he sells computers, laptops and their accessories and he also specializes in repairing them. He established his business in 2010 and thanks to his great services for his society he gained the respect of his neighborhood and became well-known with an excellent reputation.

Hasan is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD in order to renovate his shop and install a sign so that he may attract more customers. Hasan believes that this loan will enhance his current financial conditions and will give him the ability to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his shop and install a sign.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 40 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.  Leonora works very hard to provide for them.

Leonora runs a buy and sell used shoes business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of used shoes to re-sell.  Leonora has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Leonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of used shoes to re-sell.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel de 53 años de edad es una persona muy responsable y atenta, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 19 y 23 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, hace varios años posee una tienda y un molino ubicados en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don Miguel solicita un crédito para mejorar su vivienda y realizar unos cuartos para poder vivir mas cómodos con su familia por eso solicita dicho crédito y comprar todos los materiales necesarios como: arena, cemento, ladrillos, hierro, etc. y pago de mano de obra y así darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Miguel, 53, is a very responsible and attentive person, he lives in his own home with his wife and two children aged 19 and 23 years old who are currently studying. Miguel has owned a store for several years now and a grinder located in his place of residence. He is able to cover some of his household costs with what his business obtains.

Miguel is seeking a loan to improve his home to make a few rooms so that he and his family can live more comfortably, hence why he is seeking the loan to buy all the necessary materials such as sand, cement, bricks, irons and so on and to pay for labor so as to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks, iron and so on.

loans.name: Deysi Janeth

texts.es: Doña Deysi es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, hace varios años se dedica a la costura su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Deysi solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales como hilos, agujas, botones, telas, etc. para la elaboración de variedad de  prendas, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Deysi is a very hardworking and responsible person, she lives in her own home with her family. For several years now she has been making her living in sewing. Her business is located in her place of residence and with what she earns from her business, she is able to cover some of her household's spending. 

Deysi is seeking a loan to buy materials such as threads, needles, buttons, fabrics and so on to make a variety of clothes with which she hopes to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles, buttons and fabrics and so on.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es: Don Rigoberto de 36 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus cuatro hijos, El posee un  taller automotriz desde hace mas de 7 años, sus ganancias son muy buenas además  la ubicación del negocio es muy buena para el comercio. El  es una persona responsable, honesta, trabajadora y con ganas de sacar a su familia adelante, gracias  a su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos familiares, Don Rigoberto solicita un  crédito para invertir en la compra de lubricantes, y repuestos varios, así como para la reparación de una galera, y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rigoberto is 36 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their 4 children.  He has had an auto repair shop for more than 7 years.  His profits and the location of his business are very good.  He is responsible, honest, and hardworking.  He wants to help his family progress.  Thanks to his work, he has been able to cover some of his family's expenses.

Rigoberto is asking for a loan to buy lubricant and various spare parts.  In addition, he will make some repairs to his equipment.  In this way, he will improve his income and quality of life.

loans.use: buy lubricant and spare car parts.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es: Don Mariano de 55 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su  hijo de 6 años de edad, él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de hamacas desde hace mas de 10 años, su negocio es de fácil acceso, además no tiene competencia en la zona, lo que le sirve como ventaja para obtener buen nivel de ventas y demanda de productos, él es una persona trabajadora, humilde, educada y luchadora por su familia, gracias  a su trabajo ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, Don Mariano solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales como: hilos, lanas, lazos de colores, etc. para continuar con  la elaboración de hamacas, abastecer la demanda que posee, mejorar sus ingresos y darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merece.
texts.en:
Mariano is 55 years old and lives in his own house with his life companion and their 6-year-old son.  He has worked making and selling hammocks for 10 years.  His business is in a good location and he doesn't have any competition in the area.  This gives him an advantage by helping him obtain good sales and demand for his products.  He is hardworking, humble, educated, and works hard for his family.  Thanks to his work, he has been able to cover many of the family expenses.

Mariano is asking for a loan to buy materials such as thread, wool, colored ribbons, etc.  In this way, he can continue to make hammocks, meet the demand for his products, improve his income, and give his family the quality of life that they deserve.

loans.use: buy thread, wool, colored ribbons, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 42 years old a shopkeeper. She is married to Kennedy. They are blessed with three children who fully depend on them. Mary has been running her retail shop for the past two years with a monthly income of KSH 7,500, which she uses to meet the needs of her family. 

Mary is applying for her second loan term with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Mary will use the loan to expand her business to wholesale. 

With the expected profit from the business she will repay her loan and educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and build a home for her family.

loans.use: to expand her business to wholesale.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is a 44-year-old, married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has seven children.The oldest child is 27 while the youngest is two months old. 

Cleofe grows and sells seaweed. She has been farming seaweed for almost three years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy more seaweed seedlings and ropes, to gain more income and improve her livelihood status.  In the future, Cleofe would like to expand her farming business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more seaweed seedlings and ropes.

loans.name: Dancun

texts.en:
Dancun is a married man, age 29, and blessed with a family of two children - ages 7 and 2. From his quarry, he gets an income of KES 32,000 monthly, and has been in this operation for a period of four year.

Dancun has borrowed his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. and intends to use it to purchase a dairy cow for his family and tools for the quarry.  

His dream is to improve his current business for a better living.
